summary: The document comprises fact sheets and reports from the Department of Defense (DoD) and the Naval Investigative Service (NIS), addressing inquiries from the Select Committee on Assassinations about the JFK assassination. It covers Lee Harvey Oswald's military service, investigations into various individuals, and the management of records concerning Oswald and the assassination. Additionally, it outlines the structure and operations of the ONI and NIS during the pertinent timeframe.
key_findings: No records were located for several individuals the Select Committee inquired about.
Details of Lee Harvey Oswald's military service and security clearance, including his confinement and offenses, are documented.
The Naval Investigative Service (NIS) could not identify personnel involved in monitoring Cuban anti-Castro groups in Miami and New Orleans from 1960 to 1964.
A comprehensive account of the ONI file on Oswald is included, detailing how a photograph of Oswald was acquired and dispatched to Mexico City.
A list of individuals familiar with the ONI file on Oswald, along with their last known addresses, is provided.
Radiographs taken at Bethesda Naval Hospital the week of November 22, 1963, could not be connected to the unit utilized during President Kennedy's autopsy.
